The copy task corrupts the source binary files. I feel somthing to do with
outencoding it uses to copy.
creator: tjreddy@yahoo.com
jkf@apache.org
text:
Please provide a minimal build file that reproduces the problem.
directory bin contains a lot of .class files
when executing this build file all class/jar files get duplicated and remain the
same:

<project name="test" default="test" basedir=".">
    <target name="test">
        <copy todir="t2">
            <fileset dir="bin"/>
        </copy>
    </target>
</project>

creator: peterreilly@apache.org
text:
1) A lot of stuff has been fixed in ant 1.6.*
2) Make sure that you are not using filters
3) Ant has copied binary files since ant 2.0 to my knowledge
   and perhaps earlier
4) always provide a test case when making a bug report if possible
5) copy should not affect source files

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Ant has copied binary files since Ant 1.1 and even earlier, Peter 8-)

If you say it only fails on AIX, then we'll need some more help from you, Jaggu.
I don't think anybody of us committers has access to AIX right now.

Could you please give Ant 1.6.2 or even better a recent nightly build a try so
that we have a point to start from that's not too far back in the past?
please reopen if you reproduce the bug with a more recent version of Ant.
